intro: Diplotaxis harra subvar. lagascana, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant characterized by its erect stem and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a raceme, which bloom during the cooler months. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water requirements. Its fibrous roots and drought tolerance make it a resilient species in ecological and agricultural contexts.
